item.title: Sun Glasses
item.description: We create from scatch The objective of this project was to demonstrate that it is possible to create a sustainable product factory with plastic waste, human energy and solar thermal energy. With the help of Recua we reproduced the solar injection process, invented by volks.eco and Plastok. After building our machines,we co-developed and manufactored this sunglasses from scratch. We are able to take care of every step between the idea and the final product in your hand.

item.title: Work Shop
item.description: We can prove it and teach it After more than a year of experience in plastic recycling with solar thermal energy, we are available to teach you and demonstrate the effectiveness of our process. Want to learn how solar plastic injection works. take a look at our Workshop Agenda. We can show you how to create recycled plastic products with solar thermal energy.

item.title: Machines
item.description: We create our machines Our manual solar-concentrating machines are the key to the ecological production of recycled plastic objects. Based on the shared know-how, we have built, tested, used and characterized the plastic injection process using solar energy. After more than a year of using the solar thermal process, we were able to list the optimization points for a process guaranteeing the production of machines and products on a larger scale.

item.title: Support for Multiple Authors
item.description: Using Introduction, your site can feature multiple authors. Each post displays a byline – the name of a post’s author – if the author field is set in the post front matter. For example, here’s the front matter for this post: --- title: "Support for Multiple Authors" date: 2022-02-20T02:04:06-05:00 tags: ["features", "blog"] series: ["quickstart"] author: ["Hugo Contributors"] --- You can list one or more authors. item.title: Markdown Support
item.description: Introduction supports code blocks and syntax highlighting: $ complicated techie code git bash ubuntu >>> return value init foo You can easily create tables using Markdown, with rows that support readability: this is a table ! this is the 1st row this is the 2nd row this is the 3rd row edgy jo ke lands here this is the 5th row this is the 6th row Unordered lists render with high readabiltiy as well!
